intro: Matthaea ellipsoidea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed matthaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Matthaea ellipsoidea is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
